ARABIC: وَمَا يَنظُرُ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَٰحِدَةً مَّا لَهَا مِن فَوَاقٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: These people too are only awaiting a single Blast and it will not be repeated.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They await but a single blast which will not be repeated.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They are waiting for nothing except a single Cry, after which there will be no second Cry.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They had only to wait for the single inevitable blast.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They await just one Scream, which no one can avert.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And these only wait for a single Sayhah there will be no pause or ending thereto.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nor do these await aught but a single cry, there being no delay in it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: These are only awaiting for a single Cry, to which there is no delay.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: These wait for but one Shout, there will be no second thereto.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: they have only to wait for one single blast [of punishment]: it shall not be delayed by one whit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And these wait but for one shout, wherefrom there will be no deferment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: These [too] do not await but a single Cry, which will not grant [them] any respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: These (today) only wait for a single mighty Blast, which (when it comes) will brook no delay.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And these only wait for a single Saihah [shout (i.e. the blowing of the Trumpet by the angel Israfil Sarafil)] there will be no pause or ending thereto [till everything will perish except Allah (the only God full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour)].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: These only wait for a single Shout for which there will be no delay.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: These can expect only a single scream, from which there is no recovery.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And these [disbelievers] await not but one blast [of the Horn]; for it there will be no delay.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:15] And these, that is, the disbelievers of Mecca, do not await but a single Cry, namely, the Blast of the Resurrection that will herald chastisement for them, for which there will be no revoking (read fawāq or fuwāq).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (These) i.e. your folk, in case they deny you (wait for but one Shout) which is not followed by a second: this is the blow of the Resurrection, (there will be no second thereto) there will be no respite or return.
